title: Orlando1977
author: Orlando1977
content: Am a newbie here in the forum and so far everything kind looks complex for me and am really confused on what and where to even start doing. Please help out guys So what is the best place to start learning in the forum

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: This forum may indeed seem confusing for a newbie, especially to those who never visited any other forum in the past. With that being said, take your time to go through pinned messages both in Beginner & Help to learn dos and don'ts and Meta section and generally don't rush anywhere. Let all the info sink and when/if in doubt, simply ask and someone will answer.

comments.author: Zaguru12
comments.body: Welcome to the forum mate. Some might disagree but this is probably the best and most reliable forum to learn about bitcoin and almost everything it entails. The forum also broadens to other crypto currencies but to be save from falling into investing into shit coins stick to only bitcoin, that's if you a total newbie to crypto trading.As for the forum its has his rules guiding it and the most frowned thing upon is plagiarism. It gets you ban.I would say should read around the forum for tips but let me help with some links to help your way.This is the forum tips link : https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1689727.0Here is how to use the search https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5276341.0 Â just in case you have questions to ask please search before asking to avoid repeatation of thread.If you want to know about bitcoin wallets read through here https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1631151.0

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: The best place to start learning is mostly not in this forum.* If you like reading articles: https://coindesk.com/learn* If you like reading books: https://theinternetofmoney.info/* If you like watching videos: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLPQwGV1aLnTuN6kdNWlElfr2tzigB9NnjSecurity related:* https://cryptosec.info* https://www.lopp.net/bitcoin-information/security.htmlIf you want to get more technical* https://github.com/bitcoinbook/bitcoinbook#chapters

comments.author: Fullcoinese
comments.body: Quote from: Orlando1977 on December 05, 2022, 12:08:10 PMAm a newbie here in the forum and so far everything kind looks complex for me and am really confused on what and where to even start doing. Please help out guys So what is the best place to start learning in the forum this question must be returned to oneself. what are you doing on the forum? what are your interests? if you are interested in Bitcoin I guess you just have to go to the start page and look at the many threads that talk about Bitcoin.First, I think you should know your interests. and you can keep looking for information in the forums. but that's what happened to me too.

comments.author: Razmirraz
comments.body: The Bitcointalk forum will seem complicated to newcomers, we also felt the same way when we first encountered the forum. I can only advise you to continue to exist here, never get tired of reading, by reading you will gain more knowledge here.Education from Seniors can also give you knowledge, Seniors never tire of answering questions from you and then explaining at length without expecting anything from you. Respect for each other is also very important, especially seniors who have knowledge about forums because you don't necessarily get guidance outside the forum with detailed explanations from A to Z. And the most important thing is patience, with patience you will be able to develop more and be able to achieve anything what do you want.

comments.author: Accardo
comments.body: Stay in touch with this board, read and learn. When confused about a term or topic search carefully if they is an answer to it, if not create a thread and ask questions. Join other cryptocurrency communities like reddit or twitter to build your foundation on bitcoin. Read the forum rules to avoid getting banned, no plagiarism, no spamming or low quality posts. Conduct research on the information you wish to share to enable you create an outstanding post. This will as well help get you some rewards from members in form of merits.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: Orlando1977 on December 05, 2022, 12:08:10 PMAm a newbie here in the forum and so far everything kind looks complex for me and am really confused on what and where to even start doing. Please help out guys So what is the best place to start learning in the forum This is always the case of all newbie or beginner but dont get scared. Its normal to be confuse on what to do and what to say.First welcome in the forum. For your own benefit, try to read the links attached by others which will help you in journey here. Dont worry, you might get used to this when your pace started to move step by step. Start by reading rules, familiarizing it and then set up on how to post properly. Some are self taught by the way, and the only things you learn a lot here are everything related to bitcoin and blockchain concepts. Theres also altcoins but stick to one only and expand oncr you get it.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: If we talk about how people get to this or that place, then surely everyone has a reason. If you become interested in bitcoin and you register on this forum, you have already done quite a lot.Then do what most people do when they arrive in a strange place. You just need to look around. Start reading; do not rush to create topics with questions. Most likely, if you use the search, you can find everything yourself. Do not show yourself as a person who must always be led by the hand. The one who has a zeal for knowledge and who considers himself an adult and not a helpless child always achieves more.

comments.author: passwordnow
comments.body: Take your time Orlando on learning the forum, no one becomes the best and understands everything in an instant when they're just starting out.The forum has got specific sections and topics where you can read a few threads of it and its pin first like what we have here in the Beginners and Help. Just in case you don't know what a pinned post or thread is, they're mostly at the top of the threads that you see upon clicking the section like here in Beginners and Help. You don't have to rush, just do it one step at a time and soon, it won't be confusing anymore to you.
